1: Make a joyful noise to God, all the earth;\q
2:
Sing out the glory of his name;\q make his praise glorious.


\q
3:
Say to God, "How terrifying are your deeds!\q By the greatness of your power your enemies will submit to you.
\q
4:
All the earth will worship you\q and will sing to you;
\q they will sing to your name."
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
5:
Come and see the works of God;\q he is fearsome in his deeds toward the sons of mankind.
\q
7:
He rules forever by his might;\q his eyes observe the nations;
\q let not the rebellious exalt themselves.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
8:
Give blessing to God, you people,\q let the sound of his praise be heard.
\q
9:
He keeps us among the living,\q and he does not permit our feet to slip.


\q
10:
For you, God, have tested us;\q you have tested us as silver is tested.
\q
11:
You brought us into a net;\q you laid a heavy burden on our backs.
\q
12:
You made people ride over our heads;\q we went through fire and water,
\q but you brought us out into a spacious place.


\q
13:
I will come into your house with burnt offerings;\q I will pay you my vows
\q
14:
which my lips promised\q and my mouth spoke when I was in distress.
\q
15:
I will offer to you burnt offerings of fat animals\q with the sweet aroma of rams;
\q I will offer bulls and goats.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
16:
Come and listen, all you who fear God,\q and I will declare what he has done for my soul.
\q
17:
I cried to him with my mouth,\q and he was praised with my tongue.
\q
18:
If I had seen sin within my heart,\q the Lord would not have listened to me.


\q
19:
But God has truly heard;\q he has paid attention to the voice of my prayer.
\q
20:
Blessed be God,\q who has not turned away my prayer
\q or his covenant faithfulness from me.
